speaker: Skyline
text: Above the Seattle skyline flies a plane trailing behind it a banner reading "KACL."  _Act One.  Scene One - Caf e Nervosa. Roz and Frasier are seated by the window.  Frasier is waiting for his blind date._

speaker: Frasier
text: This is exactly why I hate fix-ups, she's not coming.

speaker: Roz
text: Just give her a few more minutes.  Come on, tell me about the cabin.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right.  Well, Mom and Dad used to take us up there when we were kids.  Niles and I thought it might be a nice birthday gift for Dad if we took him up there again. [_then_] Oh, this is ridiculous!  I'm being stood up on a blind date - I'm pathetic.

speaker: Roz
text: You are so insecure.  God!  Where does that come from? Jessica will be here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Jessica?  I thought you said her name was Jennifer.

speaker: Roz
text: Jennifer?  Jennifer goes out with a weatherman.  She's way out of your league.  Look, let me you have your cell phone. I'll call her and see what's going on. _Frasier, however, is entranced by a woman that has just walked in. However, she is with a man.  The couple sit at a table opposite Frasier and Roz._

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry Roz, the most striking woman just came in.

speaker: Roz
text: It's probably Jessica.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, it's not Jessica.  She's with a man.  God, I don't know what it is about her.  I can't take my eyes off of her. Do you suppose they're a couple?

speaker: Frasier
text: Tell you what, you have to go over there for me and find out.

speaker: Roz
text: What?!

speaker: Frasier
text: You owe me.  Come on.  All right, it's the table right by the counter.  Go on.  _Roz gets up, passes the woman Frasier was talking about, and goes to a woman with a man on another table._

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Roz, Roz-!

speaker: Roz
text: Excuse me, I know this is a little weird.  But my friend over there thinks you're really, really cute.  And he wants to know if you two are on a date.

speaker: Francesca
text: A date?  Oh no, Hank and I are just friends.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that's good news. [_Hank turns round and Roz notices him_] That's REALLY good news.  Hi, Hank.  I'm Roz Doyle. _Roz sits with Hank.  Meanwhile, the girl Frasier really likes gets up and goes to the counter.  Frasier decides to go and talk to her._

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, ah.  I suppose you noticed I was staring at your table and I was just wondering if that gentleman you're with - is he your husband?

speaker: Mia
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Boyfriend?

speaker: Mia
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, wonderful.

speaker: Mia
text: Would you like me to introduce you, he just broke up with someone.

speaker: Frasier
text: No... I was staring at you.

speaker: Mia
text: You were?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Gosh, I know this may seem awfully bold of me, I'm not the sort of man who hits on every woman he sees.  _Then Francesca, whom Roz accidentally mistook for the woman of Frasier's fancies, approaches Frasier._

speaker: Francesca
text: Excuse me, hi, your friend said you wanted to know if I was single. [_Frasier is worried_] It's okay, you don't have to be embarrassed.

speaker: Mia
text: Yes, he does.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's been a little mistake. [_to woman_] You see, I asked my friend to approach this [_points to Mia_] lovely woman and she obviously mistook you for the woman I meant.  Well, that's certainly understandable, seeing as you're lovely as well.  Well, it's just that at this moment, well... [_Francesca walks away_] Many apologies. [_to Mia_] Gosh, I'm sorry, let me start again.  I'm Frasier Crane.

speaker: Jessica
text: Oh, you're Frasier.  Hi, I'm Jessica - Roz's friend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Jessica.

speaker: Jessica
text: Roz thought we might hit it off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Indeed we might have, you see, if not for the fact I just met this woman, to whom I'd be to glad to introduce you, except I don't know what her name is.  You know, Roz can explain all this.  She's sitting over there next to that scowling woman.  _At Hank and Francesca's table, Roz puts her face into her hand. Jessica goes over to meet her._

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, you know, you must think I'm some sort of a smooth operator.

speaker: Mia
text: No, not really.

speaker: Frasier
text: I really am terribly sorry.  Ah...

speaker: Mia
text: I'm Mia.  Mia Preston.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mia.  Mia Preston?  The children's book author?

speaker: Mia
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my goodness. "Panda in the Parlor."  Oh, wow!  I love that book, I've read it a hundred times.

speaker: Mia
text: I'm impressed.  Most of my readers can't even count that high.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I used to read it to my son.  You know, many is the quart of milk we've poured in the back yard waiting for the Oreo Tree to grow.  Gosh, you know I'd love to take you to lunch, sometime.

speaker: Mia
text: Lunch?  Em... I...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, coffee?  Anything.  I'd just like a chance to get you know you better.

speaker: Mia
text: Well, okay.  You're certainly persistent.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, as a wise woman once wrote, "No cookie jar is up too high for a panda who will try and try."

speaker: Mia
text: Now you're scaring me. **THERE ARE NONE SO BLIND...**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne is sat reading a book as Martin enters.  He is dressed in some over-sized green rubber waders which stop under his armpits._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: I see you're wearing your buffet pants.

speaker: Martin
text: They're hip-waders.  I'm breaking them in for the weekend. Where's Fras?

speaker: Daphne
text: He's probably off somewhere with that Mia.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, it seems to be getting serious, huh?  You know, it's funny, you can always tell.  He starts using French words for no reason.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, and that laugh, the giddy one. _Daphne and Martin copy the giddy laugh.  Then Niles and Frasier enter. Niles is carrying a hold-all._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, all. [_notices Martin_] Well, there's a _faux-pas_ averted. I almost wore my big rubber pants today!

speaker: Martin
text: They're for the trip.  I'm nearly done packing.  I just gotta get my fly mast and my tackle box and there's one more thing...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, we're taking off in a few hours so _depech e-toi!_

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, earplugs for the car ride up.  Thanks.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh but Dad, don't forgot to pack some sturdy knee socks.

speaker: Niles
text: I should get some for myself.  You remember the insect situation at the cabin.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Lord, Niles, not this bug phobia of yours.

speaker: Niles
text: It's not a phobia.  The mosquitoes up there are huge.  My first summer I was chased off the end of the dock by one the size of a pelican!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Frasier_] So, Dr. Crane, when do we finally get to meet this new girlfriend of yours?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Mia, she's on her way over right now, actually.  She's going to take me out to buy some new trousers.  You see, with this new diet she's got me on, I've lost my love handles. Just when I needed them most.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, you got those movies?

speaker: Niles
text: Shush, here they are.  _Niles gives Frasier some movie tape.  Niles covers him while Frasier stores them in the wardrobe._

speaker: Daphne
text: Movies?

speaker: Niles
text: Shush.  Yes, for Dad's birthday we had some old home movies transferred to video tape.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, you know, I haven't seen these in years.  You know, Daphne, it's going to be quite a hoot this weekend.  Are you sure you don't want to join us?

speaker: Daphne
text: Gutting fish, watching home movies and hosing down your father's pants.  It does sound tempting! _The doorbell sounds.  Frasier answers it to Mia who is carrying a bag of something.  Niles is taken aback._

speaker: Mia
text: Hi, honey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Mia. [_kisses_] Come on in.  This is Daphne Moon. [_hellos_] And my brother Niles.

speaker: Mia
text: It's great to finally meet you two.

speaker: Daphne
text: Likewise.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, what you got there?

speaker: Mia
text: Oh, I baked some fat-free goodies for your trip.  Oh, where's the kitchen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right this way.

speaker: Mia
text: And there's a ton of muffins if anybody wants one.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, not for me, I have some problems with allergies.

speaker: Mia
text: Really? Well these are just wheat germ, oat bran and carob.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, throw in a sea scallop, you can phone the paramedics right now.

speaker: Daphne
text: She seems nice, doesn't she? [_silence_] You all right, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, Daphne, it's just that Mia looks exactly like our mother.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mrs. Crane?  I've only seen photos, mind, but now that you mention it, there is a resemblance.

speaker: Niles
text: It's not just a resemblance.  She's the spitting image, I'm shocked Frasier didn't mention it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_enters_] So, what do you think of her?

speaker: Niles
text: Well she's wonderful, but Frasier...

speaker: Niles
text: Does she remind you of anyone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you noticed that too.

speaker: Niles
text: Are you kidding?  The minute I laid eyes on her.

speaker: Daphne
text: Even I can see it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, she does look a bit like Roz, but she's a totally different person.  You know, in fact our relationship is unlike any I've ever had before.

speaker: Mia
text: [_enters taking him by the hands mother-like_] Come on, handsome.  Let's go buy you some pants!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_boyish excitement_] Oh, okay! _Mia leads Frasier out the door as Niles and Daphne give each other a look.  End Of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - The Cabin. It's an old rustic cabin with a stone fireplace and a wooden floorboard. Martin enters with his cases, mesmerized._

speaker: Martin
text: [_cheerfully sent back_] Oh, wow!  Look at that.  I don't believe it.  Nothing's changed. [_calls_] Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_disappointed_] Wow!  I don't believe it!  Look at this! Nothing's changed!

speaker: Martin
text: It's character, Niles.  Look at this fireplace. [_sits by it_] Your mom and I used to sit in front of the fire here holding hands.  I wonder if that... [_pulls up rug_] Oh, yeah!  It's still here.  That graffiti that you scratched into the floor.

speaker: Niles
text: That's not graffiti, Dad, that's a Latin pun.  "Semper Ubi Sub Ubi" - "Always Where Under Where"  [_N.B. In literal translation they are the correct forms of where - i.e., not wear._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that'll be Frasier and Mia.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I was really surprised he brought her here for the weekend.  What's she like, anyway?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, well, she made quite an impression on me.  I'm curious to see what you'll think.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, would you hand me that valise, I want to put on some bug repellent.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure [_hands it over_] Ooh, it's kind of heavy.  What you got in there?

speaker: Niles
text: Bug repellent! _Niles opens the valise revealing cans and cans of the stuff all lined up.  Martin exits with his cases to the bedrooms.  Niles sprays his arms and legs.  Then, as Frasier walks in, Niles sprays a puff into the air, shuts his eyes and pushes his face into it.  Frasier rolls his eyes._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calls outside_] Honey, you stay out there as long as you like. [_to Niles_] She can't take her eyes off that sunset. Is everything all set here?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I just want to make sure this VCR works for our little home movies, later. [_presses button twice_] Check.

speaker: Frasier
text: Splendid.  Niles, you know what, we're going to need some more logs from the wood pile.  Come give me a hand.

speaker: Niles
text: [_reluctant_] All right.

speaker: Martin
text: [_enters_] Fras, isn't it great to be back here?  You know, I want to thank you guys, this is some gift.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're welcome, Dad.  Listen, if you're enjoying this little trip down memory lane, wait until you see the other blast from the past we brought up here.  _Niles quiets him and he and Frasier exit to the kitchen.  Then Mia enters through the door behind Martin's back._

speaker: Mia
text: Martin?  Hi.  _Martin turns around and cannot believe his eyes - it's as if Hester has come back from the dead._

speaker: Mia
text: It's Mia.  Oh my gosh, Frasier did tell you I was coming, didn't he?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah. [_laughs_] Of course he did.  Yeah, well, nice meeting you.

speaker: Mia
text: It's very nice to meet you.  Well, it's so beautiful here.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm glad you like it.

speaker: Mia
text: Are you kidding?  I feel like I'm in heaven.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm starting to feel that way myself. _Then Frasier and Niles enter, carrying some logs.  Frasier is obviously distraught._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, nice going, Niles!

speaker: Mia
text: What happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles dropped a huge log right onto my hand when he was startled by a moth.

speaker: Niles
text: It was not a moth, it was a bat.  I could tell from that eerie high-pitched scream.

speaker: Frasier
text: That was you!  Look, frankly, I wish you'd start seeing someone about this bug phobia of yours.

speaker: Niles
text: It is not a phobia.  I have a healthy fear of our natural predators.  It's us versus them, and frankly I'm starting to wonder just whose side you're on.

speaker: Frasier
text: It just amazes me that a good psychiatrist can be so blind of something so obvious.

speaker: Mia
text: [_motherly_] Oh honey, your poor thumb, we should put something on that.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_like a son_] You know, okay.

speaker: Martin
text: God, she looks just like your mother.

speaker: Niles
text: I know, and Frasier doesn't see it.

speaker: Martin
text: You're kidding?

speaker: Niles
text: No, and he has the gall to tell me I'm blind.  He's clearly the one dealing with repressed material, not to mention the obvious Oedipal issues.

speaker: Martin
text: Argle, gargle, gooble, goop.

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Now you know how it feels, what are you talking about?!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm talking about Freud's theory of the "Oedipus Complex." He believed that every man subconsciously wants to sleep with his mother and kill his father.  It's modeled on the Greek tragedy of Oedipus, who actually did sleep with his mother and kill his father, and when he realized what he'd done he gouged out both his eyes.

speaker: Martin
text: Probably not too tough to pick that guy out of a line-up.

speaker: Niles
text: [_notices open door_] Oh, why don't we just send out engraved invitations for all the bugs of the forest? [_shuts door_] The question is: how do we bring it to Frasier's attention?

speaker: Martin
text: We don't!

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, denial of this magnitude is not healthy, it's for his own good.

speaker: Martin
text: No, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, it's for my own good.  Come on, after the way he wagged his finger at me, you can't expect I'm just going to keep quiet about this.

speaker: Martin
text: Look, the last thing I want on my birthday weekend is some big long drawn-out argument between you two, all right?  Now let's just chill this beer that we brought, all right, and just put all these weird thoughts out of our minds.

speaker: Niles
text: Fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, sorry, Dad.  Come on, hon.  Let's go see if our room still has that big creaky old pine bed that Mom and Dad used to sleep in. [_exits with Mia to the bedroom, o.s._] A-ha!  Yeah, there she is!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, a guess a warm one wouldn't kill us.  _Martin passes a beer to Niles and takes one for himself.  FADE TO:_  **MOMMA MIA**  _Scene Two - The Cabin The four are sat around the dinner table with a meal in front of them._

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, being in this place really takes me back.  Remember that summer I tried to teach you boys how to fish?  You just didn't have the knack, so I went out and I bought these two big trout and snuck 'em on the boat.

speaker: Mia
text: Oh, Marty, you're terrible!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and then I put the trout on their hooks and I dropped them over the side while you two were still arguing about the last Dramamine.  I felt bad about fooling ya', but hell, what's the harm of a little fantasy if it makes you feel good?

speaker: Mia
text: More wine?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh thanks, hon.  _Mia pours Martin the wine turning into an almost husband and wife duo.  Niles reacts._

speaker: Mia
text: Frasier, you've hardly touched your chicken.  Is something wrong?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, it's just that, well, I'm having a little trouble holding the knife because someone dropped a log on my thumb.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it didn't hurt you that badly, you are such a baby.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you are a baby, running and screaming because of a little moth.

speaker: Niles
text: I told you it was a bat!

speaker: Martin
text: All right boys, that's enough.  Not at the table.

speaker: Mia
text: Your father's right.

speaker: Mia
text: Now Frasier, if your hands hurting, I'll cut your meat for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know Niles, not to dwell on this, but you know, I could give you the number of a man who specializes in bug phobias.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh is that so...

speaker: Frasier
text: And while you're at it, I think you should talk to him about your constant chair dusting, I believe that is related.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, Dad, I think a good psychiatrist should be self-aware.

speaker: Mia
text: [_giving Frasier a piece of meat_] Open wide!

speaker: Niles
text: So you're saying I lack self-awareness?

speaker: Martin
text: Why don't we change the subject, all right?  This is a great meal, Mia.

speaker: Niles
text: It certainly was.  Frasier, when it comes to girlfriends, you've certainly struck the MOTHERload.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles!

speaker: Frasier
text: You haven't even read her books yet, Dad, it's a delightful series about an adventurous little panda.

speaker: Niles
text: It sounds worthy of MOTHER Goose!

speaker: Martin
text: [_changing subject_] So, what's coming up next week, Mia?

speaker: Mia
text: Well, I'll have to swear you to secrecy.

speaker: Martin
text: All right.

speaker: Mia
text: It looks like that Panda might just find its way into the attic. [_they all laugh_]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, MUM's the word.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sorry, Niles.  Would you maybe come into the kitchen and I'll just help you get dried off in there, all right?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, oh dear, it looks like these pants may have to be REPRESSED!

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell's the matter with you?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm sorry Dad, you can't expect me to let him sit there in his booster seat and tell me I lack self-awareness.

speaker: Martin
text: He'll pick up on what you're saying.  Do you want the whole thing to blow up?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, this level of denial is unhealthy.

speaker: Martin
text: [_shouting_] We're not in denial!  Everything's perfect! This is the best birthday I've ever had!

speaker: Mia
text: I know it's early, but I'm exhausted.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh Mia, you go, you hit the sack, thanks for dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll be along in a minute.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, before you turn in, there's a little something we need to deal with.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Jeez.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh right, Dad, your birthday gift.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yes, my gift, my gift, I want to open my gift.  It's my birthday this weekend, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on Niles. [_Niles stands miffed_] It'll be fun, come on.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes, fine! [_throws down a cloth_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh come on, seeing you and me, Dad and Mom?

speaker: Niles
text: [_realizes_] You know, I'm getting more excited by the second.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, Dad, now listen, you sit right here.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh right, okay, what is this?  Some kind of movie?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's right.  Here we go. _Niles puts the video on.  We then see lots of pictures on the television.  They show a young Niles and Frasier messing about at the cabin.  Then it shows them playing "Peter Pan," fighting with toy swords._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, my old home movies.  I haven't seen these for twenty years.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, happy birthday, Dad, now you can watch them whenever you like. [_to Niles_] Isn't it just the reaction you were hoping for?

speaker: Niles
text: One of them. _Then Hester Crane appears on the television, playing Wendy with the boys.  Frasier straight away notices her resemblance to Mia and gasps. Martin and Niles turns to look at him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!  Do you two see what I see?  My God, they could be twins.

speaker: Martin
text: Now Frasier, take it easy...

speaker: Frasier
text: You do see it?!  How could you miss it?  How could I miss it?

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, just calm him down and I'll get him a drink of water.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, Frasier, the important thing is not to blow this out of proportion.  After all... _Niles is interrupted when he feels the presence of something above his head.  He whacks the air._

speaker: Niles
text: Dear God, what was that, a hummingbird?!

speaker: Frasier
text: What is the matter with me?!

speaker: Niles
text: [_running for his bug spray_] Now Frasier, you didn't do anything wrong, your feelings for Mia stem from perfectly natural Oedipal desires.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but Oedipal desires are supposed to resolve themselves by the age of six!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh for God's sake, give me that, you idiot!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_screams_] I've blinded myself!

speaker: Martin
text: I leave you alone with him for two seconds...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, are you all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gasping_] Let me just try to calm down a little bit. She's not my mother.  _We then see Hester on the video, at the bedroom door, beckoning to Martin to come to bed.  Then in present times, Mia comes to the bedroom door and with exactly the same gestures as Hester gave:_

speaker: Mia
text: Frasier, come to bed.  _Mia exits back to the bedroom and Frasier looks away in fright.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - The Cabin's Bedroom. Mia is sat on the bed wearing only a silk dressing gown.  Frasier enters cautiously._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_scared_] Hello?  You wanted to see me?

speaker: Mia
text: [_sexy_] I hope I wasn't rushing you.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, it is bedtime.

speaker: Mia
text: Are you okay sweetie?  You seem a little tense.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, I just need to calm down a little bit. [_sits rigidly on bed_] Yeah, you see, that's better.

speaker: Mia
text: It seems like you're in pain.  Oh, it's your hand.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covering_] Yes, yes, that's it.

speaker: Mia
text: Well, I know what the problem is there.  I never kissed your little boo-boo.

speaker: Mia
text: We don't want these other fingers to be jealous, do we?

speaker: Mia
text: Frasier, honey, please.

speaker: Mia
text: Tell me what's wrong.  What's bothering you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, I don't know what's wrong with me, I'm just having a little trouble getting comfortable.

speaker: Mia
text: Well, was it something I did, something I said at dinner, what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, okay.  Gosh, this is awkward.  I just realized that you bear a striking resemblance to my mother.

speaker: Mia
text: But you just noticed it now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Mia
text: Well, it can't be that strong of a resemblance then, can it? [_Frasier looks at her_] That strong, huh?  Well listen, I hope you can get over it, because I think we have a pretty great thing going here. Don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Mia
text: We have loads in common, we get along great and don't you want to stick around long enough to see how that naughty Panda gets out of the attic?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I do, yes.  You're right, just talking about this makes me feel much better.  Oh, God, you're not my mother, this is ridiculous.

speaker: Mia
text: So, you're okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm better than okay.

speaker: Mia
text: Okay, then. _Mia stands up, opens her robe and lets it drop to the floor.  Frasier however isn't okay and looks away in angst._  _Scene Four - The Cabin. The same night a taxi horn sounds.  Frasier is sat with Mia.  Mia has her luggage ready to go._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, there's your cab.

speaker: Mia
text: Take care of yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  I'm sorry, this is so awkward.

speaker: Mia
text: No really, it's fine. _Frasier lets Mia out to her cab and shouts "sorry" after her before closing the door.  Frasier thinks to himself for a while before Martin and Niles enter in their dressing gowns from the other bedrooms._

speaker: Martin
text: I take it that cab was for Mia.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  You know, I tried to get past it but I just couldn't.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sorry, son.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, me too, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: I won't be getting much sleep tonight.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm up too.

speaker: Niles
text: I won't be getting a wink of sleep either the way those crickets are raging.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, why don't you get us all a nice big brandy? [_Niles does_] Now, don't make too much of this, Frasier.  So you picked a woman who looked like your mother, so what?

speaker: Frasier
text: "Like her" would have been fine, Dad.  We're not talking about a similar hairdo or the same crooked smile.  I was dating a replicant.

speaker: Martin
text: Now Frasier, I know you're going to go crazy convincing yourself that you've got some big complex, but couldn't it be simpler than that?  Maybe you just miss your mother. I know I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: I do think about her a lot.

speaker: Niles
text: We all do.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I think we've talked about all this enough for one night. So, it's still my birthday.  I want to watch the rest of my movies.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's a great idea, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Check. _They all sit and watch.  The first scene is of Niles and Frasier fighting._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, there certainly are a lot of us fighting.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, I wish there were more shots with you in it.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, no, I liked being the cameraman.

speaker: Martin
text: I got to focus on the things I liked.  _On the TV, Hester catches Martin taping her and waves him away, scandalized.  The Crane Boys laugh.  Then, Hester leans forward into the camera and says, "I love you." Martin sinks his head down onto the handle of his cane.  On the screen, Hester blows a kiss to her husband and sons and says, "I love you" again.  Martin looks at it thoughtfully along with his sons._
